intro: Senecio jamesii, commonly known as the James's groundsel, is a perennial flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its hairy, blue-green leaves and yellow daisy-like flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with composite flower heads. Senecio jamesii is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and sagebrush steppe.
